name: Champion of Torm - Build ideas needed
author: Valkos

posts.author: Valkos
posts.content:
So I've been thinking a lot about CoT as a class and how strong Divine Wrath really is.

I just cannot seem to find a true class combination to make it perform well without Divine Wrath being focused strongly, meaning Charisma would be intregal in my abilities, leaving unbuffed state feeling somewhat less than mediocre in power.

Do you guys have any builds where you enjoy the class and feel it performs exceptionally well?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
CoT is great in different melee builds for the bonus to saves.
As for charisma synergy builds, imo it works best in Paladin builds.

posts.author: Valkos
posts.content:
Indeed, The defensive bonuses are great in almost every build, depending on the server and what classes are attractive.

It's mainly the offensive component I'm interested in, as it is works superbly due to the fact that the dmg it gives, is unresistable and outright, a great undead/bosskiller mechanic. 

I play on a low magic server where basically all bosses are immune to crits or have extremely high hitpoints with the settings being a max of +3 on enhancements.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Just use a standard Ftr/Rog/CoT build Valkos, you can have a healthy-to-very good 45 AB and still 16 Charisma base.
With over 20 levels of CoT, you will have one hell of Divine Wrath & great saving throws to boot.
Being Strength-based & with EWS you don't particularly care about critical hits either.
Base damage should be about 1d10 (Bastard sword) +6 (EWS) +12 (34 Str) +Weapon enchantments +UMD buffs such as Darkfire +PA.

Good luck.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
If you're less bothered about Divine Wrath (and therefore CHA), two of my go-to builds featuring CoT are both Mick's own: Halfling Champion (Rogue 20/ Fighter 6/ CoT 14); and Epic Brawler Champion (Fighter 18/ CoT 18/ Monk 4). Both are currently residing on page 3 of the Full Epic (level 40) section.

Cheers
